inn1.comm: swing straightaway, from middle to off from a fairly full length. Rohit defends solidly off the front foot
full again, angling in towards off stump, no swing on this one. Rohit clips it to mid-on
wide-ish ball outside off, left alone
a lot of shape away but it starts wide outside off. Rohit leaves again
back of a length, closer to off stump this time, punched towards point
there's the waft. It's on a fullish length outside off, not full enough to drive, but Rohit attempts to hit it on the up and the ball curls away and beats his outside edge
starts with a shortish ball outside off. Dhawan stands up and slaps hard but Miller cuts it off with a dive to his right at backward point
better line now, angling across towards off and middle. Dhawan blocks it back down the pitch
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot to short cover
too straight now, and Dhawan is on his way, clipping it off his pads to the square leg boundary
fullish on middle stump, driven to mid-on
full on off stump and he gets a good stride out to drive to the right of mid-off
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended off the back foot to point
pushes it up a bit fuller, probing line in the corridor, Dhawan leaves it alone
length ball, not too much width outside off, but Dhawan doesn't really need a lot, stays leg-side of the ball, plants his front foot out, and carves it away backward of point
straightens his line now, attacks middle stump. Dhawan defends back towards the bowler

Oh, my. That's an unfortunate way to go. Dhawan comes on the front foot to push into the covers, where Duminy makes a super diving stop, and the ball rolls to AB at mid-off. Rohit had sprinted out of his crease, and was quite a distance down it when he realised the ball hadn't gone past the fielder. Stumbled as he turned. AB hits the stumps direct, and Rohit is well short, even while diving, and the bat's slipped out of his hand as well.
back of a length outside off, blocked into the covers
back of a length on a fifth-stump line. Kohli is batting outside his crease, on off stump. Leaves it alone
oooh., That's the ball that's troubled Kohli all these months, leaving him from back of a length, fifth-stump line. Kohli jabs and misses
a little fuller, left alone
a bit closer to off stump, defended off the front foot into the covers
back of a length now, close enough to off stump for Kohli to punch it to point
a bit fuller now, and Kohli, who's a foot out of his crease at least, gets further forward to defend towards mid-on
a little bit of shape in towards leg stump from back of a length. Dhawan tucks it away towards square leg
again, the leg-stump line cramps Dhawan, and he plays it cautiously off the back foot into the on side

what a delivery. That was short, and it rose to neck-height, coming into Dhawan off the pitch and following him as he tried to sway away. Hands went up to protect his face and he's lucky that didn't pop too far away after hitting his gloves
short again, close to Dhawan's body again, and he's a little late on a strange checked pull, hits it in the air but it drops short of short midwicket diving to his left
full-toss on off stump, punched towards cover
shortish outside off and Kohli goes hard at it with an angled-bat slash. Ball moves away slightly and beats his edge again
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hips towards backward square leg
back of a length on off stump. Kohli walks across his stumps and works it towards square leg
back of a length, a bit of shape in towards off stump, punched firmly to short cover
short now, and again Dhawan is in an uncomfortable position for the pull. Hits it uppishly but bounces safely down before it gets to long leg
fuller now, on off stump. Positive stride forward to drive to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
excellent carry through to de Kock. Length ball outside off, Kohli left it alone
a bit closer to off stump now and Kohli presses forward, opens his bat face to guide it down to third man
full and wide and Dhawan loves room, swings his arms through a lovely arc to send it skimming away through extra cover
pulls his length back, straightens his line towards middle stump, and Dhawan pokes it out to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, a bit more bounce here. Dhawan gets on his toes to defend that into the covers
length ball, not particularly wide outside off. Dhawan stands there and flat-bats it to cover point
full now, gives him width outside off. Kohli gets forward and plays a typically whippy bottom-handed drive through square cover
back of a length on middle stump. Kohli shuffles across and works it through square leg
back of a length on middle stump, punched off the back foot towards cover
fuller now, on middle stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
a bit of width now and he gets his weight onto the front foot and flat-bats it on the top of the bounce through extra cover
this is a little fuller and he drives with a straight bat to mid-off, and takes on AB's arm and manages to pick up a slightly iffy single
goes on the back foot to a length ball angling into him, and it goes with the angle and hits him on the back pad. Was going down leg, luckily for the batsman
a bit of air now and he comes forward to drive to long-off
length ball on the pads, goes on the back foot and clips it away to deep midwicket
tossed up on off and middle. Dhawan presses forward to defend
length ball, angling in towards off and middle, poked into the covers looking for the quick single, can't get it
a bit fuller now and he clips it away to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
fuller now, and he gets forward and steers it to backward point
short, wide, Dhawan stands tall and slaps it up and over point
fuller, straighter, and Dhawan presses forward to push it into the covers
full on middle and off and Dhawan drives to mid-off
middle-stump line, Kohli sweeps to short fine leg
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
strange footwork, Dhawan moved his back foot towards leg stump as Tahir ran in, then got back in an orthodox position and drove the full ball to mid-off
back of a length, pushed through. Dhawan goes back and tucks it towards short midwicket
down the track now, clips it to short midwicket
a touch short on off and middle, Dhawan rocks back and makes room to cut but can't beat short cover
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump, shuffles across and plays it to mid-on
fullish outside off and Kohli presses forward to push that to sweeper cover
too straight and he works it off his thigh pad to long leg
too straight again, Kohli tucks it off his hips through square leg
shortish ball on middle stump, tucks Dhawan up for room. He leans away from the line and chops it down to third man
overpitched on middle stump, and you don't do that while bowling with a 7-2 field, or any field when you're bowling to Kohli. Clips it away past short midwicket with ease
jumps down the track, not quite to the pitch for a big shot, punches it back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump and Dhawan drives fluently but Faf dives to his left at short cover to cut it off
length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot and pushes it down to long-off
that is a strange shot. It's tossed up a fair distance outside off and he uses his bottom hand and whips it down to long-on

down the track and he stays inside the line to drive inside-out towards the extra cover boundary. Steyn, running from long-off, doesn't pick up cleanly the first time, going for a one-handed pick-up-and-throw, and they run a second easily
down the track, clips it to short midwicket
on the pads now, clipped to the right of short midwicket
length ball angling away from Dhawan, who pushes at it with an open bat face and slices it away wide of slip. Looked like the offcutter, went off the outside half of the bat
back of a length on off stump, Kohli dabs it to short third man. Dhawan races out of his crease at the other end and it looked sticky but he turned quickly and got back in his crease
shortish, doesn't get up as high as Kohli expects, plays a controlled pull from waist-height through square leg
whoaaa. That was too close to him to play that cute dab to third man, and it may have come in off the pitch. Inside edges and nearly chops it onto his stumps
full on leg stump and he whips it away down the ground, past the diving mid-on fielder
tossed up on off stump and he gets on the front foot to push it into the gap to the left of cover
back of a length on off stump and he goes deep in his crease to punch it down to long-off
full on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
full on middle stump and he places his front foot next to the line to be able to push it with the turn towards cover point
nice length on off stump, turning in. Dhawan comes forward and dabs it with soft hands into the covers
tossed up outside off, I think he picked the googly there, clipped it with the turn to long-on
angles this into middle and leg and he shuffles across to tuck it towards midwicket
banged in short, and again it follows him as he's caught between fending and pulling and ducking. Hits his gloves and drops a short distance away on the leg side
short ball, not a bouncer this time, and it's at a comfortable height to pull with authority to the deep square leg boundary
fuller now on a fourth-stump line and he pushes forward to defend into the covers
shortish ball rising over middle stump and he rides the bounce  and plays it with soft hands to drop it into the on side
short, rising ball, doesn't control the pull this time, goes uppishly but lands short of Tahir running in from long leg
length ball on off stump and he goes on the back foot to punch it to mid-on, who's stationed right on the edge of the circle
tossed up outside off and AB does brilliantly to dive to his right and stop that extra-cover drive from Kohli
length ball on middle stump. Kohli tries to work it into the on side, and it skids on, hits the inside half of his bat and then his front pad
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover

huge appeal for caught behind, and it isn't given. He saw Dhawan skip down the pitch and bowled it a touch shorter on leg stump. Dhawan pressed out to defend, it hit the flap of his front pad and looped to de Kock. Bat was behind pad, no edge of any sort
down the track again, this time he gets to the pitch and drives to mid-on
length ball outside off, a bit of movement away. Dhawan looks to flat-bat it through cover, doesn't make contact
short, wide, and it's even wider with all the away movement. Dhawan has no choice but to leave it
shortish, angling in this time, and Dhawan leans back and carves it towards third man
length ball on off and middle. Kohli whips it away to deep square leg
full, angling in towards off and middle, driven to short extra cover
short outside off, massive carry as Dhawan leaves, and de Kock has to jump a foot in the air to collect that over his head

short, a bit of width, and Dhawan crashes it away to the boundary to the right of third man, who didn't have too far to move but had no chance of stopping it. Fifty up for Dhawan, superb innings this has been
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man
length ball on off and middle, tucked away to deep midwicket
short and wide, and he's lucky Dhawan couldn't force that cut past backward point
full on middle stump, whipped to short midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, makes a bit of room and punches it to sweeper cover
full, angled into the pads, flicked to square leg
dropped. That was a difficult chance for Amla, diving to his right at backward point after Dhawan cut this in the air, but it was at a catchable height and he got both hands to it
very full outside off, jabbed away to point
length ball outside off, looks to push it for a single but hits it too close to short extra cover
on leg stump and Kohli had shuffled across and had to play around his front pad, doesn't make great contact with the flick, rolls down to the left of the keeper
back of a length on off stump and he leans away and dabs it to third man
back of a length on off stump, this time he plays with soft enough hands to dab it into the off side and keep it away from the short extra cover fielder
down the track, clips it from off stump to square leg
tossed up a bit fuller, angling into middle and Kohli comes forward to work that to short midwicket

back of a length and he rocks back to power it down the ground. Smacks it straight to Duminy, who fields it, turns around, and flicks it at the stumps and gives up an overthrow. Dhawan was out of the crease had he hit
back of a length on middle stump, worked away through square leg
tossed up, angling in towards off stump. Dhawan brings out the gentle reverse-lap towards the fielder at short third man
another short, rising ball outside off. Dhawan leaves it alone
short and wide and he has to jump in the air and reach a long way away from his body to chop it down to third man
length ball slanting away outside off and Kohli comes forward to slice it away to third man

length ball, angling into leg stump, tucked away towards midwicket. Parnell overstepped there, and the crowd roars as the umpire signals a free hit. Harsh call, wrong call. His heel landed behind and his foot dragged over the line afterwards
short ball, gets up quite high, and Kohli pulls in the air, down the throat of deep midwicket
fullish, slanting away outside off. Kohli gets a long stride forward and clips it to mid-on
back of a length down the leg side. Kohli hops across and tucks it away to long leg
down the track, clipped from middle stump down to long-on
fires it in quick, angling down leg, goes with the arm. Dhawan, looking to flick, is hit on the pad.
short ball, rubbish ball, Dhawan opens himself up and pulls it to the long leg boundary
down the track, checked drive to long-off
full on middle stump, whipped to long-on
oh my. I think that slipped out of his hand. Extremely wide outside off, not just outside the tramline but beyond the return crease as well
back of a length on middle stump, punched down to long-on
short ball, angling into off stump. Dhawan plays the most effortless ramp shot of all time, simply leans away and puts it away over the keeper
length ball outside off and Dhawan pummels that down the ground, flailing his bat through a big circle to smash that between the bowler and mid-off
shortish on off stump and he opens his bat face to guide it to third man, who's now moved very fine, protecting the shorter straight boundary
in the blockhole outside off, Kohli jams his bat down on it but can't connect
bouncer over leg stump, Kohli can't connect with the hook
length ball outside off, punched off the front foot to the right of sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers

back of a length on middle stump. Dhawan stays beside the line and pokes it into the covers for a quick single. Miller flies in to flick a throw at the batsman's end, misses, and gives up an overthrow
short down the leg side, and Dhawan swivels and whips it away to the fine leg boundary. Long leg didn't have to move too far but that went extremely quickly
another short, leg-stump ball, gets up a bit higher, and this time he pulls it straight to the man on the long leg boundary

length ball outside off, comes forward looking for the pushed single towards point. Gets it in the end after Faf sends in a needless throw to the bowler's end. Hits direct, but there was no need for it
full on off stump, driven to the man at two-thirds deep cover
length ball on off stump, goes back to punch down the ground. Faf dives to his left from short extra cover to stop the single
back of a length, went with the angle away from off stump and Dhawan, looking to punch through cover, gets a thick outside edge that runs away to the third man boundary
down the track and again he doesn't pick the one that slides on, goes for the big drive over mid-off without getting to the pitch, and the outside edge nearly loops all the way to short third man
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot looking for mid-off, and again Faf moves quickly from short cover to stop it
looks to sweep from leg stump, off the pads towards short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra cover
full on off stump, and that is a super shot from Kohli, simply shows the full face and sends it screaming down the ground, between non-striker and mid-on
and again, this time it's closer to the bowler and he sticks his right hand out to stop it, deflecting it towards the  short midwicket fielder
bouncer outside off, Kohli sinks to his knees and sways away from the line
short ball on middle and leg, pulled away towards deep backward square leg
full outside off and he presses forward to drive with an open face towards deep point. They pressure the fielder, Philander, with an aggressive call for two, and he misfields to make it easier
short outside off and that's a good-looking pull from Kohli, stopped by Amla diving at short midwicket
Tahir strikes with a long-hop! Kohli rocks back to pull, hits it straight to Faf at short midwicket, at chest height. He was sent spinning by the power of the shot, but clung on safely enough
tossed up outside off and he presses forward to push it just wide of short cover for the single
full on middle and off and he pushes forward to block into the covers
length ball on middle and off and he punches it off the back foot to short cover
a bit slower, drops on a lovely length outside off, and he gets a big stride forward to defend
down the track now, pushed down to long-off to keep the strike
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish on leg stump and he hops in the air to tuck it away through square leg
shortish, angling in towards off stump. Rahane steers it to point
short outside off and he rises with the bounce and uses his wrists to knock it down to third man
length ball on the pads, nudged away towards square leg
down the track, gets to the pitch of this tossed-up ball on off stump, drives to long-off
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room and pokes it away to sweeper cover
flighted delivery on middle and off, pushed down to long-off
tossed up outside off and he lets it come to him before dabbing it towards short third man
a bit of width now and Dhawan slices under that cut and hits it uppishly to the left of short third man
length ball on off stump. Rahane presses forward to defend
back of a length outside off and he skips back to punch it to sweeper cover
fired in flat towards leg stump and he gets down quickly to sweep. Good stop from Morkel, sliding to his left at backward square leg
short outside off and he rocks back to punch it to the right of sweeper cover
beauty. Tossed up outside off, goes with the angle and beats Rahane, who pushes forward playing for turn, looking for the poked single to cover
and again, this time it's a bit wider and he went for the angled-bat drive
fired in on leg stump and he plays an uncomfortable-looking reverse sweep out to deep point
shortish outside off, gets on his toes and dabs it towards short third man
short ball outside off. Rahane flashes half-heartedly at it, makes no contact
shortish, angling into Rahane, who skips in the air and dabs it down towards backward point
length ball angling towards middle and leg. Dhawan looks to work it through the on side, misses, hits him high on the pad
short ball angling away towards off stump and Dhawan jumps across to defend
short outside off, chopped away to third man
slower ball, messes up his line, slips it a fair way down the leg side
back of a length on leg stump and he tucks it off his hips towards fine leg
in the blockhole, slanting down leg. Dhawan can't connect with the flick, off the pad towards fine leg
length ball outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
full on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
short ball on off stump, pulled away in front of square, excellent placement, there was no one anywhere in the vicinity of that deep midwicket boundary

did that carry? It was full and wide and Rahane went after it, and the edge flew low to the right of de Kock, who sprawled full-length to try and catch it. Looked like it fell just short, hit his glove, and ran away to the third man boundary
fullish, angling into the pads, tucked away towards short fine leg
short ball, pulls it but can't quite time it, hits it straight to square leg
length ball on leg stump, presses forward to work it towards square leg
oh my, what are you doing? Comes forward, prods it to short extra cover and hares out of his crease. Turns back and regains his crease, but the underarm throw smacks him on the back
pokes it to short cover again, and this time it's Rahane who hurries out and hurries back into his crease
down the track, looks for the drive down the ground, can't beat short extra cover again
full outside off, checked drive to mid-off
full and wide and he presses forward and flat-bats that drive to the backward point boundary
back of a length on off stump. Rahane looks to work it to mid-on for a single but hits it too close to the bowler
back of a length on the legs, tucked away towards long leg, and the fielder had to come in a long way from the rope to field it
length ball outside off, steered away to deep point

shot! Not much width on it and he uses his wrists to get on top of it and slap it past the point fielder. Stood there, admiring his shot, before realising it might not get to the boundary. In the end it just about does, and off goes the helmet and out comes the smile and the arms-wide celebration
back of a length on leg stump, worked away towards square leg
full, angling down leg, clipped away backward of square
back of a length on leg stump, punched down the ground to mid-on
a bit of width here but he can't beat short cover with that slap
length ball wide outside off and he has lots of room to carve that away over extra cover. Went round-arm there, did Duminy
too full, down the leg side, and that's easily clipped away into the gap to the right of short fine leg
that's tossed up on leg stump and Dhawan plays the reverse-lap to short third man
googly, turns in sharply towards middle stump. Rahane knew what was happening and he worked it with the turn towards midwicket
short ball and Dhawan swivels and scoops it over backward square, so easily done
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
down the track, doesn't quite get to the pitch, nurdles it to the right of short midwicket
googly, turning towards leg and middle. Dhawan tucks it away towards square leg
back of a length, angling across, and Dhawan is opened up and beaten by fairly exaggerated extra bounce
Dhawan is taking guard way outside leg stump to that, and it's shortish outside off and he dabs it away towards point, another easily taken single
low full-toss on the pads, and he clips it uppishly towards short midwicket
again scary bounce from Steyn outside off. Rahane flashes at it with an angled bat and it flies over his outside edge
fullish, angling in towards off and middle. Rahane shuffles across and clips it towards long leg
shuffles backwards, away from leg stump, to make a huge amount of room, and Steyn follows him with a yorker. All he can do is move his feet out of the way
shortish outside off and Rahane is beaten, having an uncertain poke at it, looking to dab it to third man

oooh. That one took off from nowhere. It wasn't particularly short outside off as Rahane looked to dab it off the back foot and he checked himself as it rose alarmingly and de Kock collected over his head
woohoo, what a reply. That was fuller and he came forward and simply scooped it back over the bowler's head
back of a length on off stump, Rahane looked to work it leg side, closed his face too early, nearly popped it back to the bowler off the leading edge
length ball outside off and he clears his front leg and slaps that disdainfully to the cover boundary. Glorious
back of a length, Rahane looks to run it down to third man, hits it too fine and it bounces away to slip
walks across the stumps to open up the leg side, Steyn stays full and wide outside off, and he ends up with no room because he has moved across. Played straight to point
slower ball, on a length, pitched on leg, Dhawan picks it up early and sends it crashing over mid-on for a flat six
lovely batting. Steyn digs this one in short, Dhawan waits for it, sways away a touch, lets it come on, and then ramps it over the keeper's head. This is Dhawan's best ODI score
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single
slower ball, short of a length, dabbed away to third man
looks to whip this to leg, gets a thick leading edge to third man
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards deep backward square leg
whoa. A bit of Viv against Hendrick (or Yashpal Sharma against Willis). Walks across his stumps and simply flicks it over the backward square leg boundary
back of a length, angling away, and Dhawan pokes and misses
looks to slog this across the line, and he's lucky that bounced over the top of the stumps
back of a length, straightening towards middle, cramping him for room. Dhawan prods it into the off side and they pick up yet another single to bring up the 100 partnership
and there's Rahane's fifty. It's full on the pads and he tickles it away neatly to the man at fine leg. It's taken him just 40 balls, and he's simply breezed away since coming in
back of a length outside off, went for the slash and couldn't connect
down the track now, ends up cramping himself for room as he looks to pull, hits it straight to short midwicket

short ball and it didn't look like he controlled that pull too well, had to fetch it from over his right shoulder. Went in the air, and dropped right onto the rope to the left  of Tahir, sprinting from deep midwicket
shuffles down the pitch, making a bit of room. Parnell follows him, bowling it on leg stump, and he pokes it into the covers for another single
full outside off. Dhawan clears his front leg and flat-bats it to mid-off
down the track now, Parnell bowls a yorker outside off. Dhawan drags it towards mid-on, bottom hand coming off the handle
down the track, Tahir floats it away from him, and he slaps the full-toss down to long-off
now Rahane comes dancing out of his crease, coming inside the line to hit over the top. Tahir has long-on back, but he clears him comfortably
back of a length, hurries through with the angle as Rahane goes back to punch. Doesn't have enough room to beat point
full and wide, slapped away to cover point
googly, starts on leg stump and it's too far away for Rahane to connect with the sweep
on the pads, clipped to Faf at short midwicket
very full on off stump, almost in the blockhole. Rahane had to abbreviate his backlift and clip it gently into the on side
short ball, and Rahane clears his front leg to pull it away powerfully. Rossouw sprints to his left from deep square leg and dives to stop it at the boundary
sees him running down the track and bangs it in short. Rahane has to withdraw from the shot and duck his shoulder

wide full-toss, slapped to the right of sweeper cover. Good diving stop from JP on the boundary. Parnell's overstepped, so we will have another free-hit. This one's close too but it looked just over the line.
in the blockhole on middle stump. Low full-toss, in fact. Rahane can't force that clip past short midwicket
low full-toss outside off, goes hard at it and drags it to mid-on

got him. That was banged in short, and he had to fetch the pull from over his left shoulder. Hit high on the bat and looped up and down into the hands of the fielder at long leg. End of a superb innings from Dhawan, he's really turned his form around here.
full on off stump, driven away to sweeper cover
short and wide to welcome Raina, who carves it away gratefully to the backward point boundary
slower ball outside off and he presses forward and steers it away to third man with an open bat face
back of a length, angling away to beat Raina, who shuffles across a long way and pokes at it with an open face
short ball, and that's dropped by Rossouw at deep square leg. Raina pulled it in the air and Rossouw was diving low to his left, but once again, he got both hands to it
down the track, squeezed away towards point
and now he takes one. Far simpler catch. Morkel banged it in again and Raina cleared his front leg and pulled it in the air once more, this time it's straight at the fielder, at chest height
full slower ball on off stump, clipped away through square leg
full and wide, sliced away towards sweeper cover
wide yorker, takes Rahane's inside edge as he comes forward to drive that through point, and de Kock dives to his left to make a good stop
another wide yorker, and Rahane flashes at it again and can't connect
brilliant. This one's speared into the blockhole on middle and off, and all Rahane can do is ham his bat down and dig it out defensively
full and wide, gets his length slightly wrong, and Rahane frees his arms and launches it over mid-off, carries all the way over the rope

got him. Walked across and looked to club it away to the leg side. It was a touch too full, maybe, and it came in off the seam and hit him on the back thigh. Given immediately, and Rahane didn't review
back of a length on off stump and Dhoni rocks back to punch that to cover
shortish outside off, slapped away to the left of sweeper cover
googly, Dhoni had looked to give himself room and it came in and cramped him. Adjusted to nurdle it into the on side
full outside off, driven to long-off
full on leg stump, clipped to square leg
full on middle stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
very full and wide, and Jadeja leaves it alone
Direct hit. Boom. Full and wide again and this time he drives to mid-off and sets off for the single, AB hits the stumps at the bowler's end and Jadeja wasn't even close to making it
short ball on leg stump, and that is very well done. Fine leg is in the circle, square leg is on the rope, and he swivels and finds the gap perfectly with the controlled short-arm pull
low full-toss on off stump and that is inviting trouble with mid-off and mid-on in the circle. Dhoni clears his front leg and brutalises it down the ground, between the stumps and the non-striker
short again and Dhoni pulls it away to the left of short fine leg. Parnell is disintegrating here
slower bouncer outside off, and Dhoni lets it through to the keeper. Given wide for height
bangs it in short, angling into the body, Dhoni looks to pull, too early into it and it rolls away towards mid-off
short and wide and he slices the uppercut high in the air, drops just short of third man
back of a length, follows Dhoni as he backs away from leg stump, and he tucks it away to short midwicket
exposes all his stumps and looks to ramp this short ball, too quick for him, and he was on the move, didn't have a stable base to play the shot from
now he takes a huge step back and across and swats the low full-toss across the line, just about clears mid-on running back to the boundary
got him! Morkel bangs it in halfway and Dhoni shuffles across to hook, only manages a top-edge through to the keeper
short outside off, Shami leans away trying to uppercut, can't connect
length ball outside off. Ashwin goes back and across trying to slog across the line. Makes no contact
takes a huge step into his crease and he bowls it right up in the blockhole. All he can do is clip it towards short midwicket
gets his length wrong here, angles it into Shami but allows him a bit of swinging room with the length. He clears his front leg and swings it away to the left of the man at long leg
now he makes room and Steyn bowls it full and quick outside off. Shami swings and misses
wide yorker, Shami slashes and misses
short outside off. Shami slogs and misses

inn2.comm: back of a length on middle stump, worked away to long leg
top-edge, and it's almost gone all the way for six. Went for the hook, it was short but shoulder high outside off, and it flew over the slops and bounced once before going past the boundary
back of a length, close to off stump, chopped down towards point
short and wide and quick and de Kock has to reach out a long way to slash it, can't connect
back of a length outside off, blocked to short cover
fuller now, fourth-stump line, punched to mid-off
length ball outside off, flat-batted to short cover
starts with a full ball on off stump. Amla jams his bat down to poke it away towards mid-off
on the pads now and he's lucky Amla clipped it straight to Rahane at forward square leg
short, rising ball outside off. Dhoni has to reach overhead and parry the ball rather than catch it. That's how high it carried
short outside off, slapped away to cover
back of a length outside off, poked away to third man, went off the outside half of the bat, a little bit of swing
back of a length on off stump, back and across to defend
shortish, no real width to force that through the off side. Bat came down at an angle and the inside edge rolled away towards long leg
back of a length outside off, sweetly timed punch, but can't beat Rohit at point
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers. Seemed to hold it cross-seam while he ran in
fuller now, pretty good line on off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length outside off, leans into it and places it in the gap to the left of short cover
short ball, hurries through, doesn't get up as high as he expected. Went into the pull and it hit him on the top of the left thigh
quick again, short and it's through Amla too quickly to pull, over his right shoulder and into Dhoni's gloves
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, straightens just a touch towards off stump. Stays inside the line and pokes it away towards point

gone! That's the first time de Kock hasn't scored a century against India. It's a bit fuller but nowhere near full enough to drive. Goes hard at it and scoops a low catch to Kohli, tumbling forward from mid-off
length ball outside off, moved away quite a bit. Left alone
back of a length outside off, steered to backward point
full on middle and off, clipped carefully to mid-on
length ball on off stump, Amla clips it away with the angle through square leg
length ball outside off, shapes away a little. Faf leaves it alone
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump, tucked away towards mid-on
fullish outside off. Brings his bat down with an open face to steer it to third man
length ball on off and middle, worked away towards square leg
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Goes back and across to defend
shortish ball, awkward bounce angling into the body. Looks to fend it away and gloves it in the air towards fine leg
fuller now, angling in towards off stump. Faf presses forward to defend towards short cover
length ball outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover point
full outside off, drives it to the left of Kohli at mid-off
on the pads now, goes back and across and works it to square leg
length ball angling in towards off stump. Amla comes forward and plays late to dab that to short third man
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended into the off side
fuller now, drives to Rahane at extra cover
down the track and Mohit shortens his length a touch, punched back towards the bowler who throws at the stumps and smacks Faf on the calves
now Faf takes a big premeditated step back and across. Mohit bowls it short outside off and he pulls it away towards deep square leg
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump, punched with a straight bat to the left of short midwicket

what happened there? That was fairly full, angling in towards off stump. Amla's bat came down at an angle as he looked to play through mid-on, and the ball took his outside edge and ran away to the right of the keeper
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to work it backward of square
back of a length outside off, whipped to mid-on
whoaaa. That was on the pads and he was early into the flick, nearly popped it to square leg, fell a couple of feet short of Rahane
length ball on a fourth-stump line, pushed into the covers for one
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Faf defends off the back foot
lovely. Faf came down the track to hit down the ground and the ball curled away from him and beat his outside edge by a long way
back of a length outside off, jumps across to defend into the off side
tight line on middle and off, and he works it away through forward square leg
good ball, quite full and angling in towards off stump. Amla stays back and defends into the off side
fullish outside off, goes for the drive, slices it off the outside half of his bat to point
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended towards extra cover

oh man. That was excellent fielding from Rahane at cover after Amla flowed into an on-the-up drive. He throws to the batsman's end and misses the stumps with the returning Amla a long way out. Raina backs up brilliantly, only has to underarm at the stumps from a couple of feet away with the batsman still a fair way from the crease, and he misses
length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
a bit fuller and he goes for the drive, slices it towards point
good bouncer, angling in over middle stump, and Amla ducks under it
gets his line wrong for the first time today, I think, slides this full ball down the leg side
full outside off, nice wavy follow-through to caress that towards mid-off, where Kohli fumbles it through his legs
short ball, pulled from outside off, rolls away to the square leg boundary
back of a length outside off, driven off the back foot to cover point
banged in short outside off, Faf leans his head away from the line. Called wide, but was it really over head height?
short outside off, had to pull that from over shoulder height, hits it uppishly but lands safely two-thirds of the way to the square leg boundary

gone! The short ball's done the trick. Again it was outside off, not the easiest line to pull from. Amla top-edged it and Shami took it brilliantly at long leg, over his head with both hands, moving backwards but ensuring he stopped well short of the rope
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, guided away to third man
fuller now, and now Faf lets it come on to steer it to third man
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, worked with the angle into the on side
length ball angling in towards off, tiny bit of spin away. Goes on the back foot to punch it towards point
length ball outside off, slapped to cover point
full and wide now, hung in the air a lot longer. Reached out this time and carved it to backward point
a bit of air again, but closer to off stump, driven to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, cut away to the left of sweeper cover
nice loop again, outside off, driven to sweeper cover
banged in short wide outside off, pulled down to short midwicket
short again, and Raina anticipates very well at mid-on to start moving to his right as soon as Faf shaped to pull, cut it off , spun around and threw to the bowler's end
back of a length outside off, may have kept a touch low. Looked to punch through cover, got a thick inside edge towards fine leg
back of a length outside off. Faf shuffled a long way to tuck it away towards long leg
back of a length outside off. Stops on the pitch and AB is too early into his punch. Takes his bottom hand off at the end, and it drops short of Rahane at short cover
full, angling in towards off and middle, driven to mid-on
sticks his front foot a long way across to sweep from outside off, stays with the angle and hits him on the pad. Big appeal, but it was clearly outside the line
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a bit slower and wider, driven to long-off
full on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way and pushes it down to long-off
goes for the lap sweep from wide outside off, slips past the inside edge into Dhoni's glvoes
fuller now and he drives down to long-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, lets it come on and dabs it to point
fullish outside off, walks across and clips it through midwicket
length ball on middle stump, defended with a straight bat to short midwicket
fullish on off stump, punched to mid-off
short ball, AB pulls it with a sweet crack of the bat, well in front of square, rolls his wrists over and deep midwicket has no chance haring to his left
whatashot! Down the track and he picked the length of that slower ball brilliantly, enough width for him to flat-bat it crisply through extra cover
a bit of flight, angled in towards off and middle, pushed into the covers
down the track and he bowls it quicker, slaps it to short cover
again he's out of his crease, it's straighter and he clips it down to long-on
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
angled in a bit quicker as he comes forward to defend, inside-edges into the pads
goes wider of the crease, angles it in, Faf looks to drive through mid-off, goes off the inside half of his bat into the on side
starts with one on the pads, tucked away towards deep backward square leg
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. Worked away behind square leg
shot. That's not a bad ball, length ball on an off-stump line. Faf clears his front leg, makes himself room and punches on the up, between the bowler and mid-off
angles it in towards leg stump now, pushes it from the crease towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, jumps a long way across and pokes it towards short extra cover
short ball outside off, through Faf quickly as he looks to pull, top-edge flies high over the keeper
full on middle stump, pushed firmly back to the bowler
a bit slower now on off stump, driven inside-out to sweeper cover
down the track now, plays a whippy drive to the left of long-off
floated up, angling in towards leg stump. Played carefully to short midwicket with a straight bat
down the track, looks to whip through midwicket, gets too close to the pitch and ends up dragging it through square leg
flighted outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, hops back and across to defend into the on side
back of a length, angling in towards leg stump to cramp AB, who was shaping to make room. Ends up pushing it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, feet off the ground as he punches this to cover
back of a length on off and middle, and he jumps away from the line to be able to squirt that down to third man
fuller now, on off stump, shuffles across and clips it to square leg
down the track, making room all the time. Umesh bangs it in and he goes for the pull and top-edges it over the keeper. Productive area of the ground, that.
tossed up on middle and off, driven to long-off
down the track and he shortens his length. Adjusts to knock it towards point
fullish, angling in towards middle and leg, driven back to the bowler
down the track again, clipped from off stump down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, makes room to punch it to sweeper cover
a bit of air outside off, and AB is quickly in position to sweep powerfully to the forward square leg boundary
sees him making a bit of room, angles it in towards leg stump. Opens his face and pokes it away towards point
and again, back of a length tucking him up for room. Manages to squeeze it away for a single to square leg, had to dive into the crease to complete it
down the leg side now and it's clipped away to fine leg. They take two, but not without a bit of drama, as Dhoni pulls of his party trick of deflecting the throw into the stumps
back of a length, angling into the body. AB skips away from the line and pokes it towards point
back of a length outside off, carved away to deep point
back of a length on off stump, guided down to third man
full, angling in towards off and middle, clipped away towards deep square leg
a bit of flight outside off, and he presses forward for the pushed single into the off side. Dhoni moves quickly to his right to stop it and de VIlliers wisely sends Faf back
rocks on the back foot to cut now. Wasn't quite short enough for that, can't beat point
this one was short enough, plenty of width too, and he rocked back and lifted it up and over cover point
a bit of loop outside off and he comes forward and dabs it to short third man
a touch short, no real width this time, and he backs away to force it through the off side, edges it past the keeper for another four
angled into leg stump. AB drives straight, Jadeja sticks out his right foot to stop it
outside off now, driven to short cover
angled in again, a bit flatter, stays inside the line and drives to short cover
excellent delivery, doesn't pick the length up and it goes with the angle. Was looking to drive through cover, hits the inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler

driven to sweeper cover and India are convinced there's a run-out. Good throw in from Mohit, right next to the stumps, and Dhoni did the rest even as AB stretched to complete the second. They go up to the third umpire, and he's a good couple of inches short when the bails light up. Massive moment for India
sees him skip down the pitch and drops his length a touch shorter, turns in sharply, a bit of bounce too, and hits him on the pad
tossed up nice and slow outside off, driven down to long-on
quickish length ball on off stump. Goes on the back foot, works it to short midwicket
a little slower now and he sweeps it away to deep backward square leg
length ball on off stump, goes deep in his crease and works it with the turn towards backward square leg
angled in towards the angle and it slides on towards the pads as he presses forward. Off the inside half of his bat into the leg side
full, angling down leg and he clips it to short fine leg. Flat throw from Mohit, and Dhoni lets it go between his legs and hit the stumps. Single safely completed, though
down the track now and he fires it in a bit quicker, clipped to straight midwicket
goes back to a length ball that slides in towards off stump, punches it to short cover
out of his crease again, whips it down to long-on
length ball turns in from outside off, worked with the turn to short midwicket
quickens it as Miller skips out of his crease, and he clips it to short midwicket again
angled in towards off and middle now and he tucks it away through square leg
nice loop, angling in towards off. Miller defends into the covers
a touch wider now and he comes forward to drive to sweeper cover

sharp turn now and they're appealing for a bat-pad catch. Pressed forward to defend and it popped up towards where a short leg might have been stationed and Dhoni moves quickly to his left to catch it. Not given, not reviewed. Straight off the pad
goes on the back foot now, works it with the turn towards deep square leg
nice loop outside off and he sweeps it away to the right of deep backward square leg. Umesh hurls himself to his right to stop it at the boundary
floated up outside off and he moves across to work it away through backward square leg and bring up his half-century
length ball on off stump, checked drive to long-off

ooh. That's flighted outside off and he makes very good contact with the sweep, hits it in the air in front of square and even a desperate dive from Mohit Sharma, moving to his left from deep midwicket, can't help him get close to it
tossed up, angled in towards middle stump, driven inside-out to the left of long-off
full on middle stump, too close for the drive, and he swipes it back towards the non-striker, Jadeja dives to his right to stop it, deflects it towards extra cover
on the pads, quietly tucked away towards square leg
slow flight, angled in towards off. Miller drives out in front of his body, slices it towards backward point
a bit quicker and fuller, steered to backward point
good ball, hung in the air a bit and dipped and turned sharply to hit Faf's front pad as he came forward to work it into the leg side
back of a length, turns in towards off stump, punched down to long-on
this goes with the angle as he steps onto the back foot, cramps him up a touch, punches it to short midwicket
again that angle into middle and leg, a bit fuller, and he clips it away to short midwicket
got him! Came down the track and looked to flat-bat it down the ground. Wasn't the right ball for it, it was shorter than ideal, and it hit high on his bat and popped straight into mid-off's hands
length ball angling away, carries through at a nice height to Dhoni after Duminy leaves it
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Duminy shuffles across to defend into the covers
excellent line, so tight on off stump, and JP hops across to defend
bouncer. Duminy gets into a low crouch under it, allows it to tennis-ball bounce into Dhoni's gloves
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a bit fuller on off stump, whipped to mid-on
tossed up outside leg, swept away to the long leg boundary
slants it across to middle and off, gets a little bit of turn. Comes forward and pushes it towards cover point
angled in towards off stump. Duminy presses forward and nurdles it into the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, goes on the back foot to punch it to long-off
tossed up, angling in towards off, and he presses forward to push it into the covers. Jadeja can't pick-up cleanly, and Mohit cleans up behind him
lbw shout as Miller looks to work it leg side off the front foot. Turned sharply there. Looked like it pitched outside leg
length ball on middle stump, shuffles across to work it through midwicket
length ball outside off, carved away to sweeper cover
back of a length on off, slanting away. Skips back and across to defend to mid-off
shortish ball, gets it to lift sharply as Duminy looks to tuck it leg side. Hits the handle, or the gloves, and pops down close to the batsman
back of a length close to off stump, and that's nicely steered past slip with an open face. Shades of Ranatunga there.
looks for the same shot again, doesn't time it as well, and Raina moves across from slip to cut it off with a dive
ooh, Duminy always struggles against that ball. Plants his front foot forward to defend and it comes in with the angle and hits his pad. Extra bounce too, pops up towards slip
a little fuller and he gets his foot inside the line to poke it into the covers
and that is that for JP. Goes for the reverse sweep, and it goes with the angle again, hits his glove, and pops up to present the slip fielder an absolute dolly
length ball outside off, comes forward to defend with an open face
a touch shorter, goes on the back foot to push it towards cover point
fuller, angling in towards off stump, comes forward to play that towards mid-on
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Parnell hops off the ground to defend

shortish, a bit of width outside off, slapped to third man. A bit of a mix-up leaves Miller halfway down the pitch, but the throw comes in to the bowler's end. Dhoni throws to the other end and Shami has the bails off but Miller has managed to slide back in, as the third umpire confirms
bouncer now, Parnell ducks under it
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
shortish, slanting away from off stump. Parnell looks to pull and he's a long way from connecting. Stayed a bit low as well, bounced through to Dhoni
short, pulled from shoulder height to midwicket, standing on the edge of the circle
beauty! Goes with the angle from around the wicket and smacks him on the front pad as he comes forward to defend. Big appeal, not given, may have been going down leg
fuller now, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on off stump, clipped to mid-on

another run-out! Sweeps, finds Umesh at deep square leg, and they try to take on his arm again. Excellent throw, and Dhoni doesn't have too much work to do - in fact, he's flicked it into the stumps. They go to the third umpire, and the bails light up with the sliding Miller's bat in the air.
length ball outside off, goes back and across to defend

loud, sustained lbw appeal, given. Goes on the back foot and it turns in sharply and hits him on the back pad. Not sure if it hit in line. He's reviewed. No inside-edge on it, Snicko confirms. Hit the back pad on the knee roll, just in line with off stump, and then hits the top of middle stump according to Hawkeye. Two umpire's calls, and that means he's a goner
full on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket
tossed up outside off, hung in the air a while, and he waited and waited and then clipped it firmly back to the bowler
full outside off, driven back to Raina
full on leg stump, clipped through midwicket
full again, driven down the ground to long-on
nice slow flight towards off stump, presses forward and blocks back to the bowler
full and quick on middle stump, pushed back firmly to the bowler
goes with the angle with extra bounce as he presses forward to defend, hits high on the front pad
shortish outside off, chops it into the ground, bounces up to slip
back of a length, punched to mid-on
a bit of flight outside off and Steyn plonks his front foot out to defend
dip and turn to hit Steyn's pad as he plants it across to try and work it into the leg side
low full-toss on leg stump, flicked away through square leg
short on off stump, tried to make room to cut, can only pop it straight into the hands of cover point
short, rising ball getting up to neck height. Morkel fends it away uncomfortably, off his gloves into the gully region
back of a length, tucked off the thigh pad towards long leg
shortish, gets on his toes and works it away towards fine leg
in the blockhole on leg stump, flicked away through square leg
flat and full, angled in towards leg stump, nudged away towards short midwicket
a bit of air now, angling in towards middle and leg, and he clears his front leg to slog-sweep, misses it completely and it straightens to clatter into the stumps
carrom ball outside off. Tahir squeezes it away to backward point
slow, loopy full-toss on off stump, swiped down the ground to mid-off
length ball angling in towards middle stump. Parnell goes deep in his crease to punch into the covers
goes with the angle from wide of the crease and hits him on the pad again as he comes forward to defend, pops up wide of slip. Was going down leg quite clearly
full outside off, driven away through square cover
short ball, sits up over off stump and Parnell pulls it away powerfully to the midwicket boundary
banged in and it flies high over middle and off. Parnell makes room to ramp but it's too quick for him
another short ball, rises higher than the one he pulled for four. Isn't fully in control, manages to keep it down short of deep square leg
full, angling across to off stump, squeezed away to backward point
bouncer over middle and leg, and Tahir crouches awkwardly to evade it
speared in towards middle and leg and he tries to reverse-sweep, only gets it as far as slip
comes down the track to go inside-out, doesn't get to the pitch and chips it towards mid-off
nice loop outside off and Tahir is at full stretch to defend
a bit quicker, angled in towards off stump, and again he gets a good stride out to defend
that looked like the carrom ball, angled in towards off and straightening. Tahir defended it safely enough
sees it flighted outside off and goes for a big drive, edges it thickly past slip for four
fires it full and flat down the leg side to start the new spell
back of a length, turns in towards off, and he makes room to flat-bat it to long-off
and that is that. Round-arm, angled in, goes with the arm and hits him on the front pad, halfway forward to defend, and it's lbw even before he appealed
